title: Erin Molan teases the new children's product she's been working on for the past year
text:
Erin Molan revealed she had been working on a new project for babies on Tuesday.

And now the doting mother, 36, has teased the line of children's products she is set to release with Baby Dream.

She told Nine Style on Thursday: 'It's a very basic baby item with a few practical additions'.

'It's a very basic baby item with a few practical additions': Erin Molan has teased a new children's product she's been creating for the past year

The sports journalist, who recently broke her arm in a nasty fall, explained that it was a product that she had struggled to find when her one-year-old daughter Eliza was born.

Erin said that despite looking for alternatives of the baby essential, she couldn't find a version that she liked, so she made her own.

'I'm certainly no fashion designer or creative type, but it made our lives so much easier so hoping it might do the same for others,' she explained.

Exciting new venture: The sports journalist, who recently broke her arm in a nasty fall, explained that it was a product that she had struggled to find when her one-year-old daughter Eliza was born

'It might go well, or it might not, but it's been great fun and a great experience either way.'

Erin took to Instagram on Tuesday to post a photo of herself with daughter Eliza and Baby Dream co-founder Cris.

She revealed to her legions of followers, that she had been quietly working away at it for the past 15 months.

'So much research, designing, then redesigning, then re-re-redesigning, patenting,' she explained.

New project: Erin took to Instagram on Tuesday to post a photo of herself with daughter Eliza and Baby Dream co-founder Cris. She revealed to her legions of followers, that she had been quietly working away at it for the past 15 months

'So many samples, fabrics, cuts, sizes, trials and errors, experiences, lessons and little joys along the way.'

Erin continued: 'So wonderful to work with this wonder woman Cris, the nurse on duty who helped deliver Eliza - fairly brutal way to meet but we've taken our relationship from home run back to first base'.

'[I] have such a greater appreciation for all who venture into this kind of space... it's getting closer to being ready to go and can't wait to share soon,' she added.
description: Erin Molan revealed she had been working on a new project for babies on Tuesday.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
